block.p: Elizabeth Marie Belle, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Russell J. Belle of Town and Country, Mo., was married yesterday to Dr. Matthew Hitchcock Bigham, the son of Dr. and Mrs. Darrel E. Bigham of Evansville, Ind. The Rev. Michael P. G. G. Randolph performed the Episcopal ceremony at Christ Church Cathedral in St. Louis.

Mrs. Bigham, 28, is a buyer for the May Department Stores Company in St. Louis. She is also an alto in the St. Louis Symphony Chorus. She graduated from Miami University of Ohio and was a Fulbright scholar in 1993 and 1994 in Berlin. Her father is a vice president and the general manager for specialty chemicals at Solutia Inc. in Town and Country. Her mother, Jeanne M. Belle, is a residential sales associate in Town and Country for Gundaker Realtors.

She graduated from Miami University of Ohio and was a Fulbright scholar in 1993 and 1994 in Berlin. Her father is a vice president and the general manager for specialty chemicals at Solutia Inc. in Town and Country. Her mother, Jeanne M. Dr. Bigham, 34, is an assistant professor of anesthesiology at Washington University in St. Louis and a cardiothoracic anesthesiologist at Barnes-Jewish Hospital there. He received a bachelor's degree and an M.D. from Yale. His mother, Polly Hitchcock Bigham, is the community development director in Evansville for the American Cancer Society. His father is a professor of American history at the University of Southern Indiana there. The bridegroom's maternal grandfather, Ethan Allen Hitchcock, is a former chairman of WNET-TV in New York.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
